review.itemreviewed: Pocito Auric Cut Spin Helmet - Kids'
review.reviewBody: I have to buy kids helmets, hats, googles, etc. which can be frustrating due to styles. I ordered an adult XS-S and it was too big despite measuring my head. So to the kids sizes and styles I went. It's a good thing I like bright colors! I do agree that POC helmets run large from what you measure. I am glad this helmet has an adjustment, as I needed it to dial in a good fit. I'm not crazy about the ear flaps but have been wearing a full helmet for years. The chin strap is uncomfortable and I hope that gets better over time. I wish that manufacturers recommended or paired googles with specific helmets, because I am now searching for a different pair of goggles.
review.name: Adult with a Small Head

review.itemreviewed: Pocito Auric Cut Spin Helmet - Kids'
review.reviewBody: Too large.  The range is too large so hard to find a good fit.
review.name: 55-58 cm is too large for a 55 cm head.

name: Pocito Auric Cut Spin Helmet - Kids'

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Seemed like a good light hiking boot, but after wearing them around the house a few times they were just too small.  Felt narrow and toes were hitting the ends of the boot...
Returned them..
review.name: Too Small, returned

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for two reasons: they’re Oboz; and they were 50% off. These aren’t the latest, greatest model or style, but I’ve found Oboz to be consistently well crafted, durable, and comfortable. Backcountry does a great job offering quality gear at a significantly reduced price. They also communicate well post-purchase without overloading my inbox. A winning combo! I’ll be back.
review.name: Good boots. Good price.

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Was skeptical because I like to see 4.6 stars or higher. Decided to pull the trigger since they were 60% off. Great deal. Just got these in today size 13 couldn't be happier on how they feel! I have a big wide foot and they fit me perfectly! The only complaint I have is that the grey rubber outsole that goes around the bottom portion of the shoe is a little darker in real life than it is in the picture. shoe Durability is yet to be seen obviously but so far happy that i purchased them!
review.name: Good Stuff so far

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, good traction
review.name: Fantastic hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These felt a little snug at first, but they loosen up with wear and are extremely comfortable and supportive. They aren't really a serious hiking shoe but they are very stable and versatile. My only complaint is that they don't breathe very well, so my feet sweat in them, and the laces are ridiculously thin.
review.name: Quality, versatile do-everything shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these to replace a similar pair of Oboz boots. Unfortunately they're too tight in the mid-foot so I returned them. Backcountry kept bugging me to review them despite the return so here you go.
review.name: Didn't work for me

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Comfortable right out of the box.  Somewhat snug fit with the expectation of future give as wearing continues.
Highly recommend
review.name: Excellent mid weight boots

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got these for my husband. Broke them in at home and then took them all around Maine and Acadia. He loves them! His feet are so happy. And his ankle is supported too. He wears a size 10 in gym shoes and got a 10.5 in these. Fit perfect right out of the box. No issues with blisters or anything negative, really.
review.name: Fantastic Boot. Love Them!

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’d never heard of Oboz before but I was willing to give them a try. I needed a replacement boot for my wolverine and Merrill boots that wore out after just a month of construction work. As soon as I opened the box i was taken back with the look. The gunmetal looks great and they are more tonal that the contrast shown in the photo. I put them on and was instantly impressed by how comfortable they were. My other boots needed an Ariat insole but not these. They felt like they were made for my feet. I am building myself a barndominium and spend 10-12 hours a day working on my feet. I have worn them everyday since I got them. My feet are never sore after a long day of work with these boots. I also use them for mountain biking and the tread has great grip. It is rare to find the perfect born of form and function. I highly recommend these boots.
review.name: My favorite Boot!

review.itemreviewed: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hiked to 4600' and 7+ hours right out of the box. Love this boot!
review.name: Sooo comfortable!!

name: Sypes Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Oyster color not as pictured. I own this pullover in several other colors and I love it. When I opened the package and saw the color khaki I was disappointed. Definitely not the cream color in the photo.
review.name: warm and soft

review.reviewBody: It's so cozy and cute, seems to be well made. I love the color, love the turtle/cowl neck. I'm usually a small or medium top. I bought a small and I'm glad I did, it's a relaxed fit.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Soft, comfortable with a roomy but not baggy fit. Looks nice with jeans or leggings.
review.name: Love it!!

review.reviewBody: I am 5'6'' 155 lbs muscular athletic build. I bought a size medium and it fits me very well and the shoulder panels add extra maneuverability for us broad shouldered gals.  If you are on the slimmer side I would suggest sizing down like the other reviews advise. This fleece is very soft. The neck is double lined material while the body of the garment is single, and a little bit thin. I wish the whole garment would be doubled up for added warmth! It is a raw fleece on the inside and polished on the exterior so no fuzzies build upon the outside from washing it which is great. The neck is very cozy and keeps the heat from escaping, no need for a gaiter and can easily be pulled up on the bottom of your face if winds get up. It is long enough to reach the middle of my but which is nice to keep drafts from getting up your back. It also has very nice stretch which moves with you. Elasticated cuffs keeps your sleeves from sneaking up your arms. Colour is true to picture, deep emerald green with a slight heather. Not the most flattering shape but cozy and functional for a mid layer.
review.name: Functional

review.reviewBody: I’m very happy with this pullover.  I’m between a size small and medium in mountain hardwear styles due to the bust.  Since it appeared to be a looser fit on the model, I decided to go with the small.  I’m glad I did because it fits perfectly and is very comfortable.  The length works well over leggings.  I’m wearing it for warming up pre-yoga and for lounging.  I also really like the dark storm color which is a pretty charcoal gray.  I would purchase another in a lighter gray or navy.
review.name: I love this pullover!

review.reviewBody: I bought the mauve color and loved it so much I came back and bought the black one! This is super soft and cozy, stretchy and comfortable. I love that there are pockets, I love that the neck is loose but still adds warmth, and I love that this is a longer fit (hip-length ish). Roomy enough to be worn over a shirt, but doesn’t look too big or baggy when worn on it’s own. Really, really soft.
review.name: Soft and cozy favorite sweatshirt

name: Camplife Pullover - Women's

review.reviewBody: I use this for riding in NWA, we get very cold winters here and it's handles the weather like a champ. I don't get overheated and stay comfortable throughout the day. Would definitely recommend this to a cold weather rider.

This Jacket is a great all-around jacket not just for Mountain Biking but for any other activities. The fit is true to size, the Jacket is very breathable, durable, and great wind protection I would highly recommend this for anybody that's looking for a versatile light weight jacket!
review.name: Great All-Around Jacket

review.reviewBody:
I’m a big believer in softshell apparel, and I’ve loved how flexible this hoodie can be. 

I’ve worn it on cooler trail rides with just a jersey underneath, as an outer shell for warmer days skiing, and just as a casual piece around town.

It’s super breathable, water resistant, and can fit into your layering system as an outer shell or mid layer if you need that level of insulation on cold rides. 

The hood is pretty low-profile, and not designed to fit over a helmet, so this is a feature to use off the bike or if you underestimated how cold it would be and you wear it flipped up under your helmet. 

I need length in the arms and torso since I’m 6’2”, but I am rail thin and stuff like this can end up very sail-like in the wind and at higher speeds. I went with a size large and stuck it in the dryer instead of hang drying like I typically do for apparel like this. Fits perfect now. 

All in all, this is a well-thought-out minimalist softshell hoodie that serves its purpose in a wide range of use cases, and is built to take some abuse. 

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Stoked on this thing!

review.reviewBody: I use this just as much hiking and climbing as I do riding. The fit is dialed and the hood offers great coverage. I highly recommend this as an extra layer for any adventurer. It's a durable layer and heavier than a minimal rain cape. because of this it can't pack down into itself.
review.name: Perfect tech hoodie

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket so far. The fit is perfect for me. This has been my go-to activity jacket. I have been running and biking in it. I have also used it as a good mid layer under my shell here in rainy Seattle. It doesn't have a ton of insulation, but for the warmer days it is great as a breathable do everything jacket. The fabric is very durable, and I don't feel like I will have any future issues with it. Feels like I could take a couple good falls off my bike on it and I would most likely break myself before the jacket. I will say one downside is that in windy conditions that hood does end up catching the wind. Make sure that you tuck it behind your back if you are commuting.
review.name: Great In-between Season Jacket

review.reviewBody:
The fit is exactly how it should be. Enough room underneath fit over your normal jersey or even a heavier trail flannel but not so much that it's loose and baggy. The drop tail hem is nice and OR does a great job tapering the wrist openings so that the top/outside of the sleeve extends over the top of your hand/glove. The inside of the jacket has a soft, brushed feel and not fleecy. It's also textured so it kind stays off or your skin which not only helps create air space for insulation, but also keeps it from being clingy once you do create some perspiration. The outside of the fabric feels durable and able to handle abrasions or passing brush well, but I haven't tested that yet. The hood also has a great fit that moves with the head well and has good peripheral vision. With the hood up and zipper zipped, the opening circles the face perfectly with the zipper(covered) hitting right below the chin and the hood sitting right at the brow-line. The more fitted opening also keeps it from parachuting when down while on the bike.
I look forward to taking this on more chilly morning rides, but it also does great sitting around enjoying post ride hangs.
review.name: Great extra layer!

review.reviewBody: Great riding jacket for those windy/rainy days, really love how lightweight it is without compromising on performance. The fit is perfect, not too tight where it feels restrictive but also not baggy to where there's excess wind flap. The double weave stretch fabric is extremely comfortable as well and doesn't get in the way with quick, snappy maneuvers. Overall, really impressed with this jacket - this will be my go-to for any cold or wet weather riding.
review.name: Durable, Lightweight and Perfect Fit

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a fanny for most rides under 3 hours but wanted something with a little more capacity for those longer rides (but no backpack) and this vest is the perfect solution. It is comfortable, stays very secure on descents, and holds more than a fanny. Only gripe is your back will get a bit sweaty

review.reviewBody: I read some other reviews saying this backpack was too small but that was not my experience at all. I'm 6ft 175lbs male. Fit very well. I also wear an insta 360 chest mount under it and it fit perfectly. The only thing I wish it had was slightly larger front pockets to fit my phone but I do have a larger size phone so I get it. Great quality pack, easy to fill and wash out. You can tell the clips are high quality and should last a long time. Very happy to have this on those long day rides.

description: Buy the Julbo Rush REACTIV Performance Photochromic Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rush REACTIV Performance Photochromic Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Julbo Rush REACTIV Performance Photochromic Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Got this sunglasses (Black/Red) as a replacement for old Tifosi shades. No issues so far. Really like the clarity of lenses, and how they adjust to different conditions. It feels like they do not block bright sun light, but rather tone it down.
review.name: Great for mtb

review.reviewBody:
I'm at the point in my adventuring where I pretty much have all the gear I really NEED, so I thought I'd treat myself and get something cool like  these shades. As it turns out, they act more like safety glasses. The tint is almost non-existent. I wore these running at noon on a sunny day and then driving. I was squinting the entire time. They never really got dark at all. 

I do frequently wear a different pair of Julbo shades with the spectron4 lenses, and they're awesome for high sun activities. However, these adjustable lenses just don't work as advertised. 

Luckily, backcountry was great with the return.
review.name: Did not adjust

review.reviewBody: The Rush with Reactiv lenses are my favorite! They fit my face perfectly so are comfortable for long rides. The Reactiv lenses also make riding in the woods and  the dark so much easier!! No more having to change lenses constantly and regretting your choice. Thank you Julbo for actually making a real performance piece of eyewear! The fact that they look good ismjust a bonus!
review.name: most comfy glasses out there!

name: Rush REACTIV Performance Photochromic Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
Built this up with a mechanical Shimano 105, roval rapide bars and hunt aero 44 wheels. This thing flies. I’m a couple hundred miles in on this new bike and have consistently been setting PRs.

A couple things to note about this frame:

-The carbon seat-post (20mm offset) and fork give plenty of compliance where it’s needed. For aluminum it’s quite comfortable. Paired with carbon wheels, I don’t think any cyclist would truthfully feel a difference.

-This bike is stiff (in a good way). It’s built for Criterium races where maximizing power transfer and quick acceleration is important. I race, but also use this as a daily driver, and that stiffness is so nice to have when sprinting for KOMs or trying to maintain zone 2 watts on workout rides. Now, don’t get stiff and uncomfortable mixed up - it’s plenty comfortable (see note 1!)

-It’s durable. I crashed (oops) the other week, and while nothing broke, my carbon wheels and bars and metal groupset have got some decent scratches in them. Like enough to notice at coffee stops. The frame on the other hand doesn’t even have a scratch in the finish. Very happy about that. Not so much about everything else, alas it was my own fault.

-compared to a tarmac frame, which would offer additional marginal gains, sure, I’m saving enough to finish the build with top spec parts. And, because I fall off my bike now and then (nobody is perfect, okay) I don’t have to worry about a frame replacement.
review.name: Aluminum rocket

name: Allez Sprint Disc Road Frameset

review.reviewBody: I love the look of this coat - I bought it in the olive color. I figured it would be cute, but I didn't expect it to be as warm as it is, and I'm so happy with it. I love it and highly recommend.

review.reviewBody: It was a gift for my daughter and she just loved it. North face always give good quality merchandise. My granddaughter want one now so that's going to be her Christmas present.

review.reviewBody: I'm 4'11 and the small was too big so I went to exchange and got an XS and it fits so perfect. love the material & how it hugs you , not too tight or loose , it's the perfect fit and I weight 133lbs ...for reference . It runs pretty big in my opinion , and if you don't like large coats that run long , this is the one for you .

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves her jacket maybe someday the book bag and lunch bag

review.reviewBody: I love my new North face coat it is very warm and fits well the quality is great!!

review.reviewBody: Love it

review.reviewBody: I cannot tell you how long I've been looking for the perfect coat and I finally found it. Everything it has, I wanted. I thought it would be too short, so I got one size bigger and it fits so perfect! I can't wait to wear it...
review.name: Took me so long to find you!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] So stylish and warm. Really liked the slightly cropped length. Kept me nice and cozy during my trip to Japan. But the faux fur isn't removable and despite following the instructions, drying it crisped the fur. I returned and TNF gave me a refund in gift card form which was great, but I can't recommend anyone buy this. The parka has a detachable fur lining so IDK why this didn't!
review.name: Can't wash without frying the fur

review.reviewBody: The material is super soft and so comfortable. You can easily move around in this jacket. I'm normally a small but sized up to wear a hoodie underneath but you don't have to. Either way love the size and jacket
review.name: Great jacket for adventures

review.reviewBody: Love this bomber style jacket. Super warm and flattering. Got it in the nude color

hasVariant.name: Backland FR Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Atomic Backland FR Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought them and absolutely loved them for a most of a season, until at the end of a cold day one of the poles snapped just as described in the other review, hanging by a thread and unusable. Quite a letdown on an otherwise awesome product. That was in March 2021 and they haven’t been in stock for any meaningful amount of time since. Bummer.
review.name: Great until they break
comment:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out to Atomic with your comments on the Backland FR. We're sorry to hear about your experience. We appreciate your feedback and will be sure to pass your comments along to our design team.

The Backland FR is probably back in stock in March 2022.

Kind regards,
Franzi

review.reviewBody: I love these poles to death. They have been great and have saved me with the screwdriver features. But I have had them for about a year now and after taking a line in the backcountry, I got to the bottom and looked at my pole hanging by a thread. Some how, I snapped the aluminum clean in half just below the locking clasp. I love Chris and all I buy is atomic and these poles have been great until now
review.name: My favorite poles ever except...

review.reviewBody: I'm using these poles every day I'm skiing whether I'm on the slope, in the park or in the backcountry. Just love `em!
review.name: Super versatile poles

name: Backland FR Ski Poles

review.reviewBody: Bought for a trip to the city. Awesome size and very easy to carry,.
review.name: I would buy again

review.reviewBody: went on a short trip with this and was able to fit everything I needed! also fit underneath the plane seat so awesome as a carryon.
review.name: would last a while, very durable!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had my Base Camp Duffel for a few weeks and and it rocks!  The navy blue/yellow combo looks great - gets noticed constantly by friends and co-workers.   The main compartment fits my laptop, Giles, lunch bag, jacket, shoes etc easily.  I particularly like the layout of the compartment pockets and the water bottle sleeve that holds my coffee thermos perfectly - the compartment pockets are easy to access and hold just the right amount of accessories.   I’m buying these bags for my teenage sons!
review.name: Outstanding!

review.reviewBody: It's perfect for a one-to two-night stay. The way it converts from a backpack to a shoulder pack is very convenient. I was looking for something this size, and North Face delivered.
review.name: Little Bag with Big Punch

review.reviewBody: Not quite what I was looking for. Nothing wrong with it. Packs down small.
review.name: I returned it, not what I needed.

review.reviewBody: In-love with this bag. I've used a variety of duffle bags and backpacks over the years for the gym, backpacks always end up being too small to carry everything I need and duffles are too unwieldy -- I find myself walking back to my car from the gym in not the greatest areas sometimes at 10-11 PM. I was looking for something large enough to fit everything I needed, and that was easy to carry and leave my hands free just in case. This bag has met all of my requirements and more. There are tons of organization options, it's incredibly roomy given the size and weight. It's easy to carry, to swap back and forth between a backpack and a duffle. I do wish it had a dedicated shoulder strap to carry it in the traditional duffle sense like the larger versions, but the bag isn't really detracted from the last of it.
review.name: The perfect gym bag.

review.reviewBody: I used this as a carry on for a recent trip and it was perfect! It held everything I needed and easily slid under the seat in front of me! No more fumbling around with the overhead bin! My husband wants one now!
review.name: Perfect Carry-On

review.reviewBody: I'm so excited for this bag! I've been thinking about buying it for a while and so glad I finally did! I saw it in the airport and needed to give it a try. The color is gorgeous and it has plenty of space for my stuff! It fits great without being too big and the material feels sturdy. I'm looking forward to using it for all my trips!
review.name: Awesome bag, ready to travel!

review.reviewBody: I agree with another reviewer. This is junk riding on the coattails of the basecamp duffel.
review.name: Junk

review.reviewBody: Love it! Great for travel! Lightweight and spacious!
review.name: Great!

name: Base Camp Voyager 32L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody: Really like this beanie but compared to other ones I have owned it runs a bit small and doesn't completely cover my ears.

review.reviewBody: I use the hat under my ski helmet. I was looking for a warm but thin enough hat that would cover my ears. I have a small head and it was hard to find a small enough hat but this one works for me! I washed the hat and it shrunk slightly (perfectly) to fit me.
review.name: The fleece lining is so cozy!

review.reviewBody: Super warm for my head... Love the feel of it and look of it... Everyone asks me where I got it...
review.name: Cool looking and warm

review.reviewBody: Purchased as a Christmas gift, she loved it!
review.name: Gift purchase

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for. Perfect fit, lightweight and warm. Just wish they had more color options.

review.reviewBody: Great fit on my Large noodle, warm and great styling. I wear this one for work when it gets really cold, meets the dress code and style required. Doesn't fully cover your ears though, which is fine for me.
review.name: No brainer to keep the brain warm

review.reviewBody: I bought this hat for work because the materials are quality and stay warm when wet. Not to mention the color and subdued logo meet my agency's uniform policy. I am replacing this hat not because it wore out, but because i lost it. I have had this hat for work all winter and fall. Of duty I have had it in Israel (yeah. It snowed on us there in December), The Italian Alps, And the Spanish Pyrenees. That hat was my buddy. Six weeks has been too long without it. I am so very happy you still make it. --Odie
review.name: All Over the World

review.reviewBody: I have a small head and this beanie fits just right. It's not on the tight side but not loose either. My head is 6 7/8 hat size and small/medium fits good. It is very warm and cozy as well!
review.name: Beanie fits well!

review.reviewBody: This coat is very warm! The pockets and hood are great. The fit is very boxy and oversized, which is great for layering and casual wear. I like that the cuffs are not tight- makes it easier to layer up and not worry about too much at the wrist. I would not recommend this coat for anyone who wears an XS and is petite height because the XS may be too large for you. The S fits like a generous M- which was great for my purposes.
review.name: great warm and casual coat

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this jacked a little over a month and I love it! It’s beautiful, love the 4 pockets, warm but not too hot. I think it’s perfect for fall/winter in Seattle.
review.name: Warm and great looking!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is high quality and warm, very pretty color red. I returned it though, because the extra small fit more like a large. Even with layers underneath, it wouldn’t work. I’m 5’2 110 lbs. typically wear XS size 2-4.
review.name: Huge

review.reviewBody:
I am a huge fan of Keen and I got all my Keen shoes with some difficulties. 
Therefore, I am dissapointed with my new Newport shoes. They are assimetrical and the inner insoles are very thin.
review.name: A dissapointment from Keen

review.reviewBody: LOVED THEM BUT TOO SHORT, RETURNED THEM INTENDING TO REORDER A SIZE LARGER, BUT NO LUCK NOW. TOO BAD, MY LOSS!
review.name: BIG KIDS NEWPORT

review.reviewBody: Love you so much for my daughter bought a pair for my son now
review.name: Another pair for my son

review.reviewBody: Fantastic! I love them...The next week i bought another pair of the Big Kids Newport sandals! Comfortable and so easy bto slip on. Goes with everything you wear too!
review.name: Big Kids Newport Shoe

review.reviewBody: Huge Keen fan -- mainly for the rubber toe. Both my boys are HARD on shoes and always wear out the toe within the first week or two. Our school requires brown leather shoes and these last until they outgrow them! Keen Designers--Would love to see the Chandler shoe in a brown leather for boys!!
review.name: Only shoe my boys can't put holes in!

review.reviewBody:
I have very square, short and wide feet. These shoes both fit in length and width at the same time. They are unbelievably comfortable. 

I used the fitting guide and was directed to get size 5, and ended up with size 3. I don't know if that means the shoes run large or if I misunderstood the fit instructions.
review.name: Roomy toe box

review.reviewBody:
Only thing I'm not delighted with is the velcro strap across the ankle. 2 prob with the strap --1) it restricts my ankles movement when sit or on some rocky terrains. 2) it like to grab the bottom of my pants,or socks & 
 especially with knits, damages fabric. Runs wide - but I like that as it will work with multiple thickness of socks.
review.name: Great Fall Walking/Hiking shoe

review.reviewBody:
The shoes are so grippy even when they are muddy. Also they are extremely light and so fun to run in. I recommend these shoes to everyone that is eight years and younger.

(Written by an 8 year old boy)
review.name: I love these shoes they are amazing!

review.reviewBody: This is our first time owning Keens and this might be the first shoes ever that last my son an entire year. Look great, fit well, seem very sturdy, he loves them.
review.name: Built to last

review.reviewBody: Great and comfy for hiking or wearing to school without socks. In a little water or in rain they are fine, but my son walked through knee deep water with them and it took two days to dry!
review.name: Not for wading in water!

name: Newport Shoe - Kids'

hasVariant.name: Hiker 1/4 Cushion Sock - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Darn Tough Hiker 1/4 Cushion Sock - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hiker 1/4 Cushion Sock - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Darn Tough Hiker 1/4 Cushion Sock - Men's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The best.
review.name: The best.

review.reviewBody: I have used several pairs of these socks as my only socks for 5 years. They survive daily use with an active job, hiking and outdoor pursuits on the weekends, and anything else that you could throw at them. No odor issues between washes due to the wool. Great support from Darn Tough who stands behind their warranty. They were my only choice for hiking the Pacific Crest Trail. Two pairs were able to get me over 2652 miles in comfort. I probably won't use any other brand of socks again.
review.name: Darn Tough makes the best socks.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit comfort and length for any use.
review.name: Darn good Socks

review.reviewBody: I recently discovered Darn Tough socks. I walk, hike, hunt and work on the farm putting them to the test. They are extremely comfortable and DO NOT blister on my feet. Highly recommend giving these a try.
review.name: Best socks out there

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite socks for wearing in my boots. I wear mid hikers everyday for work & for most of my outdoor time. I recently wore these on a mule deer hunt where the temps were between 12F - 28F. These socks kept my feet comfortable hiking in the snow and glassing for hour on the high ridges. I bought 3 pairs and will be buying more.
review.name: Darn Tough Hiker 1/4

review.reviewBody: I have worn a lot of different socks over the years for hiking and these are my favorite for sure. I love the 1/4 length and they are super comfortable and don't smell bad after a couple long days of hiking. I wear a size 9.5 in most shoes (Nike, Altra, Astral, etc.) and the size Medium fits perfect for me.
review.name: The Best Hiking Socks

review.reviewBody: These socks are awesome. Use them hiking and trail running. Have held up great over many miles, and seems to prevent blisters and dry quickly.
review.name: AWESOME

hasVariant.name: Allpa 60L Gear Hauler Tote
hasVariant.description: Buy the Cotopaxi Allpa 60L Gear Hauler Tote online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Love the quality, and practical functionality of this “adventure bag”.
review.name: Great organizer

review.reviewBody: Great addition to our Cotopaxi gear. Lots of room, durable!
review.name: Excellent Bag

review.reviewBody: This bag is huge😍 it is going to be our snow ski bag. It will fit all of our helmets and gloves perfectly. I love the zipper pockets which is great for our season passes and the other pockets will be great for our snacks.
review.name: I love bags!

review.reviewBody:
I was on the fence with this bag, it is just a tote, right?? AH. . NNOOOOOO!! This bag has served so many purposes and I have only had it for about a month. It has worked to haul uniforms for work, laundry in an Extended Stay, last minute purchases on a long vaca, and "stuff" for camping. Now that I have it, I can't find a reason to NOT use it. 
To be honest I thought it would get too heavy and my husband was not a fan at first. Now we are both like. . . . let's use the Cotopaxi tote!! It is easy to carry with the handle size, easy to clean, easy to consolidate two to three smaller bags of stuff!! If you are wondering. . . yep!! Buy it!
review.name: 100% a must have

review.reviewBody: Can't wait to use this in the trunk to keep all ski things organized and accessible and outside of the overnight bag.
review.name: For car skiing

review.reviewBody: I'm an outdoor play therapist and needed a bag that could essentially be a traveling office - this bag is perfect! I can fit everything I need and the side pockets help keep it organized. Highly recommend!
review.name: perfect bag!

review.reviewBody:
I actually love that this is open air because it's perfect for all my river gear!!! I just love it! My stuff can start to air dry on the car ride home already and that is awesome! Very practical.

Needs a big shoulder strap though!!! Other people are saying it and I completely agree. Make it detachable and it'd be perfect! Give it a little zip pocket somewhere to store if people don't want to use it now and then.

Great thing though! I enjoy it A LOT!
review.name: The perfect river gear tote

review.reviewBody: My brother got me one for my birthday last year and I had to come back and buy another. So convenient for hauling gear for camping. Keeps at the little stuff together and easy to find. Tons of pockets.
review.name: Love this bag

review.reviewBody: This was the exact bag I've been looking for to bring on all of the trips my family and so take in our RV. I have several Cotopaxi products and love each one of them so knew it would be the same for this tote. Bonus that it came in my favorite colors.
review.name: I love Cotopaxi

review.reviewBody: I use this bag for work and it holds so much stuff! Great quality and love the pockets. There are two sizes of handles too which I really like. Blue color is so cute!!! Would highly recommend.
review.name: Best Tote Bag Ever

name: Allpa 60L Gear Hauler Tote

review.reviewBody:
I have both this and a Smith Trace. Initially bought this Scott Centric for gravel and some mtb races.  However, the Centric has become my go to helmet for just about every road ride.  Without looking at the specs, they weigh what seems like the same, but the Scott just feels better on my head, and has better ventilation on warm/hot days.  No issue with the new MIPS.  I still grab the Smith on occasion when I don't want to hurt it's feelings.
The Trace has a little lower profile, but I do like the look of the Scott.
I like the idea of the reflective rear on the silver color as I do regular night rides through cooler seasons.
Con - this is my third Scott helmet, and they still need to lengthen the chin strap.  This one is better than past models, but still.  I can use this helmet with a skull cap. which was difficult with past models.
review.name: Great helmet, over Smith Trace

review.reviewBody: I am cycling in the heat hills and humidity of GA. This helmet is super lightweight and airy. I love it. Have it in two colors.
review.name: Love it

hasVariant.name: Ducan Spine 28-35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Ducan Spine 28-35L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ducan Spine 28-35L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Ducan Spine 28-35L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Intended Use: Frontcountry (music festivals and urban adventures with family) and backcountry (day hikes and overnight hut trips) use in the South (e.g., hot, humid, rainy). Needed something that had excellent back ventilation, variable load capacity and quality construction.

Here are my initial impressions after using for 5 days in Disneyworld, which is arguably the best test for this pack's attributes: 5 days of 90 degree weather, 60 miles of walking, loads from 10-30 lbs, wearing average 10 hours/day

Pros:

-Very comfortable to wear with heavy/light loads. Hipbelt does it's job with heavy loads. Shoulder straps very comfortable. Bungie chest strap could provide more tension, but curved shoulder straps don't need much to be in correct position imo. 
-No back sweat! This was a huge plus. 
-Rolltop makes for super easy loading and middle zipper makes for easy access. Can pack main compartment so food/rain gear is at front of pack and less-used items stowed in bottom/towards back of pack.
-Mesh pockets on shoulders ideal for storing sunglasses
-Mesh pockets on pack held 2 Nalgenes easily and could be accessed and put back while walking (this was a great feature)
-Pack fabric bomber--stood up to being dragged on concrete and on/off rides over and over again

Cons: 

-Cords kind of annoying--especially if you are accessing middle zipper often. Excess cord also hard to store neatly when pack volume is low. 
-Some wear on mesh (small holes) after using metal Hydroflask and setting down on concrete (probably not designed for this).
review.name: Unicorn Daypack

review.reviewBody:
This pack is about 95% of the way to being awesome.

I like:
- the backpack floats on your back beautifully 
- the belly zip (not sure what to call it)
- the roll top is top notch üëç. I love being able to shrink down the pack for day trip where there is a base camp. 
- the backpack/shoulder straps are nice and wide and have convenient pockets on them.

Things to improve:
- small stowe pocket, could be slightly bigger 
The chest clip is a bungee which is okay but with heavier loads, it doesn't hold the straps on the chest all that well
-exterior rope thingy could use an additional hook or two. I had to keep an eye on stuff in the "net / rope" because stuff fell out of it

Summary 
I like the roll top and the fact it shrinks, that is the reason why I bought it and am happy I did so. Felt good and stable on my back. The primary thing I don't like is the bungee chest band, I wish it was more like the traditional style.
review.name: I like it, but still room for improvement

review.reviewBody: I used this bag as cabin baggage on a plane and the size is perfect. I like that I can go through the zipper on the top to have a 2nd access to my belongings. I like the basket system or the straps which take the bag off our back and which is less hot when worn for a long time. Several pockets at the waist including a waterproof pocket. Side pockets for water bottles accessible when carried on our back. I also like the rain cover integrated under the bag. Ideal for traveling by plane and traveling without a suitcase. However, I have not tried it on a hike. For this purpose, I don't think the zipper concept would be ideal and I would like more compartments instead of just one.
review.name: Travel and carry on

name: Ducan Spine 28-35L Backpack
Ducan Spine 28-35L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Love the versatility and quality of this shirt. A must in every closet.

review.reviewBody: I have purchased many Vitamin A swimsuits and have nothing but wonderful things to say about their fit and quality. I purchased two of the Linen Oversized shirts thinking they would be on the same caliber but I have been really disappointed with how poorly they are holding up after only where them a few times. The fabric is so thin that the material at the seams is starting to rip. Just a bit sad especially due to the price point.
review.name: Disappointed with Quality of Fabric

review.reviewBody: I have this in small and extra small and the difference is negligible. Small is slightly more oversized, it might be a little longer. (For reference I‚Äôm 5‚Äô3‚Äù and 4/6 or 27/28 depending.) Great linen!
review.name: Great cover up

review.reviewBody: This shirt is amazing, I have it in 3 colors now, but the quality of the fabric and construction are not aligned with the price point. I had to mend rips in the shoulder and armpit seams within 2 wears even though I washed on delicate and air dried. The fabric is supposed to be a gauzy linen but I would also warn that there is some shedding of the fibers if you wear the lighter colors with anything darker. Would buy in all colors if overall fabric and construction quality is improved. Otherwise the cut and color options are a 5!
review.name: Love this shirt, but quality is an issue

review.reviewBody: Skis are awesome!! They are stable on the groomers, cut nicely through the crud and have a great look. I was impressed with their response and liveliness coming out of turns. Love them!
review.name: Excellent Response!!

review.reviewBody: I really like these skis. Just skied them for 4 days and they floated well for a 98mm waist, blew through chopped up snow and held their own bombing down groomers at the end of the day. They are quick to turn and I love them in the trees and tight chutes. Really fun over all and the only weakness is that I will only tour on them for short sidecountry laps since they are a little heavy with the shift binding attached, but I really bought them as a lighter front country ski that can tour if needed and they fit that bill perfectly.
review.name: I really like these skis.

review.reviewBody: I’m around 5”7 and bought the 168cm. They’re super light to hike up and they carve pretty well going down (this was important to me as I’m an ex ski racer and mostly ski in resorts).
review.name: I’m around 5”7 and bought

review.reviewBody: I skied these for the first time this weekend, and I loved them! Great feel and transitioned from the icy conditions to the softer snow well.
review.name: Great All Mountain Ski

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been waiting since last year to get on these skis
Looking forward to it my last set of boundary pro 100s were great all mountain skis
review.name: I’ve been waiting since last year to get on these skis

review.reviewBody: The wide shovel allows it to perform surprising well in Powder for how skinny it is. Playful and easy to maneuver in the trees. And easy to get on edge on the groomers. Not the stiffest ski but holds an edge and doesn't chatter too much at speed. A good all round ski, especially if you want a one-ski quiver for the resort.
review.name: Good All Mountain Ski

review.reviewBody: The impulse 98 ski feels very responsive and light yet on fast downhill skiing there was no chatter. Got to ski them in the trees in powder and they really handled well. Light enough for uphill off piste yet charge hard on piste.
review.name: Impulse 98

review.reviewBody: These are absolutely perfect! So lightweight and LOVE the design!
review.name: The Best!!

review.reviewBody: I just finished my first two days on these at Crested Butte and I could not be happier. I’ve never felt this much control on a pair of skis across all types of terrain. From piste to powder, moguls, and everything in between, I felt pure joy. I can’t recommend highly enough.
review.name: Blown away

review.reviewBody: Full time patrol and wanted a ski that was quicker edge to edge. I have the Boundary Pro 107s and these are like the more nimble, faster turning brother of the Boundary Pro. We have a lot of tree runs and narrow bump runs and the Impulse 98 is my new daily driver. Awesome work ski, fun to ski on days off also. You can't go wrong, if on the fence about these I recommend them. Durable base so far, holds a good edge on hardpack manmade slippery concrete.
review.name: Impulse

name: Impulse 98 Ski - 2024

review.reviewBody:

review.reviewBody: Warm, comfortable, perfect fit. My only concern is how easily the feathers seem to poke through the shell material. I’m hoping this will work itself out as the jacket breaks in
Awesome jacket ! Perfect fit and super warm . Lost the old one and immediately replaced it

review.reviewBody: Amazing puffy jacket. Fits true to size and is very warm for the fill.
review.name: Best puffy

review.reviewBody: Very nice jacket with good loft to weight ratio. I’m 6’, 165 lbs, with a 43” chest and sizing chart indicated size large. The fit is right on the money. Construction and material appear to be durable. I were recommend purchasing this jacket for outdoor and/or around town wear.
review.name: Warm and versatile jacket

review.reviewBody: So soft! This jacket has truly gone next level. 5’11, 180 and this jacket is perfect in a medium. My son has stolen it and he’s 5’10 145 and loves it! I’m getting another
review.name: Super soft and very warm

review.reviewBody: Overall, if you're looking for a reliable, high-quality down hoodie that can handle anything from daily wear to outdoor adventures, the Men's Transcendent Down Hoodie is an excellent choice!
review.name: Warm, Lightweight, and Versatile!

review.reviewBody: Perfect jacket. I personally love the more snug fit. Great for fall, late fall weather.
review.name: Quality piece of clothing

review.reviewBody:
Finally purchased this jacket after coveting it for months, and I'm so happy I did. This is literally the softest thing I own - you truly have to feel it to understand how silky soft the face fabric is. It's also incredibly light (about 3 ounces lighter than the Helium Down Hoodie, which I also own and love) and super packable, meaning it would be a great layering option on cooler shoulder-season backpacking trips when rain isn't a big concern. I'd say warmth-wise, it's similar to the Helium Down Hoodie as well. 

Time will tell how durable this jacket is - I'm only a week into wearing it so far - but so far I'm very impressed with the quality and haven't seen any issues so far. That said, if you're looking for a tough, highly weather-resistant down hoodie, the Helium will always be a great choice, but if you want a jacket that you can take hiking, head to dinner in with the parents, and keep wearing while you snuggle up in front of the fire, the Transcendent is hard to beat. This will certainly be my everyday jacket whenever the weather is cold and (mostly) dry this winter.
review.name: Like wearing a cloud

review.reviewBody: Too expensive poor quality control w/ no front zip
review.name: Example: 2 much

review.reviewBody: Finally got to ski this ski. Skied some Michigan ice.  For a touring ski it held well on ice and hard packed. I am sure this ski will do very well in POW. Solid ski, easy to turn from GS to short.
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, responsive, solid shape, good all-around touring ski.
review.name: Solid Backcountry Skis

review.reviewBody: Very stable for the weight. Ski with confidence on and off piste, including gnarly all mountain conditions. Climbs extremely well. Easy-peasy kick turns
review.name: Solid skis

review.reviewBody:
Perfect for my kind of ski I didn’t find defect.
Off piste was good easy to turn and control. Then  in pist was good when I went fast. 
Very good feeling
review.name: Amazing ski

review.reviewBody: These are my go to big mission skis. At sub 1400g/ski they allowed me to tour all day with out giving up performance on the descent. I skied a lot of bad snow with these and the damp cork tip and tail helped hold an edge and really dampened the vibrations. Definitely recommend.
review.name: Light and Responsive

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wasn't too concerned about the color, I just knew OBOZ shoes are absolutely perfect for me!  Comfort, style, durable, and oh, I really like the color! 😀
review.name: Wonderful boots!

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am so happy I bought these shoes! I am a size 8.5 and these are true to size! I wear them everyday and they keep my feet cozy and protected!
review.name: Most comfortable shoes I own!

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve had these about a month now and they are so comfortable they have beautiful color and seem to be very well made I love them
review.name: Great product

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Nice quality boot, but sized to small. The heel end and the tongue is too narrow to even leave the top unlaced somewhat. The tongue does not cover enough.
I had to return as there was no wide size available.
review.name: Nice looking quality, sized too small.

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recently bought my second pair of Oboz. I have tried many many other hiking boots but these are by far the best. Comfort, support, great looking, long-lasting and durable but not 'clunky'. These are very well made boots. I hope they still make these when I'm ready for my next pair.
review.name: My favorite hiking boots

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these boots after not having new ones for awhile. I hiked some fairly rugged trails in Glacier national park and the boots were amazing!
review.name: Super comfy

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
My feet run narrow and are size 7 or 7.5.  I was thrill to hear that an Oboz runs narrow.  

They really do and wondered if the toe box was wide enough.  I tried an 8 and barely enough room for the length of the foot. So I will try an 8.5 and hope that works.
review.name: Great Arch Support - Too Small

review.itemreviewed: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I listened to the reviews that says they run small, I ordered a half a size larger but they are still small but worse they are super super narrow. If someone orders a 10.5 size shoe, I doubt their feet are that small and narrow. 

They look nice though, unfortunately I will have to return.
review.name: very narrow

name: Sapphire Mid B-Dry Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Portland Design Works City Rover 500 USB Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
As a light it does a very good job. I used it mainly for riding on the trail before the sun rises. 
The USB recharging works well and I have not had an issue with the battery life.

My biggest complaint about this light is that it vibrates in its mount. It is so bad that as soon as there is enough sunlight I turn it off, take it out of the mount and put it in my pocket.
review.name: Good light, but...

name: City Rover 500 USB Headlight

description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Sonic -20 Sleeping Bag: -20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sonic -20 Sleeping Bag: -20F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the NEMO Equipment Inc. Sonic -20 Sleeping Bag: -20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Worked perfectly for a fall bear hunt in Alaska. I am 6’1” and purchased the XL and in was nice with a little length to spare.
review.name: Fall in Alaska

review.reviewBody:
I have a total of 5 nights in this bag over two different trips. The warmest ambient air temp I have used it in was 23F, which I expected to be sweating in the bag but that was not the case. 

The lowest I used this was -19F (which is very close to the rating here) and I would not expect this bag to be warm at that temp, but no way it is a -20F bag. I had to use a liner and base layers to sleep cold when it was -19F. This feels like a 0F bag to me, and I sleep hot.

Compared to the Marmot Col Membrain -20 or the Feathered Friends -25 bags that my tent mates had, this one just doesn't have the loft of the others.
review.name: Cold bag

name: Sonic -20 Sleeping Bag: -20F Down

review.reviewBody: I have owned Kuhl pants for many years.  The fit of this pant is terrible!  I am 5’7 “  115 lbs and bought the size 2 pant.  They are baggy, horrible fit and the fabric is thin and unflattering.  Sent them back.
review.name: Horrible fit

review.reviewBody: The pants are cute but have so much stretch that I needed to size down 2 sizes to get a fit that didn’t sag massively unpleasantly on a 7-10 mile hike. Since it took several hikes in each size to figure this out I’m now stuck with two sets of not inexpensive pants I can’t wear. Bummer!
review.name: Cute design, no where near true to size

review.reviewBody: I bought these as an alternative to jeans for work (casual yet sometimes physical workplace) and I love the fit and the look. I actually bought a 4 and a 6, honestly the sizes are very similar. The 4 seemed a tiny bit small but by mid-day they felt better, almost loose. Drawstring on the inside is very clever although I didn't need it on the 4. The waist did not gape in the back at all. ( I hate that!) I am 5'7'' and the length was perfect. Back pockets are flattering.
review.name: My new favorite pants!

review.reviewBody: I have several pair of Kuhl pants, several tops, etc.  This is the first time I've been disappointed in their product.  I am 5'5" and the pants were to long. The inseam hangs low, making it uncomfortable for hiking. Yes, they have a cinch string but you have to pull them up by putting your hands in your pants, not from the ankle. The cinch pulls from the outside only, and I prefer to keep my boot covered for many reasons.  My main problem is the zip pocket on the side of the leg is too low for someone my height. It is not on the thigh as pictured.  When I put a phone in the pocket, the phone slides around to the back of my knee, making it difficult to bend the knee.  I love the gray color and back pockets are flattering.  I still love this brand and but just not these pants.
review.name: First disappointment with Kuhl

name: Trekr Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This lightweight water proof jacket looks very sharp. The color is shiny black. It fits well for either a short sleeve under it for warm days or can comfortably wear a sweatshirt on cooler days. The three zip pockets are great for storage space. Overall very satisfied with this purchase and recommend it.

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the style of this jacket. I am usually a Medium but bought a Large just to make sure it can accommodate multiple layers. Provided little warmth per se, but very wind and rain resistant.
review.name: Carhartt’s most iconic

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Does the job and keep you dry. Could be a little bit more breathable but it is a generally good jacket and even better for the price.
I am 5"11 and weigh 215lbs and it fits good.
review.name: Good buy

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wore it and the first day working out in the rain it soaked through within an hour. My sweatshirt underneath was soaked through around the shoulder and arm area. Working in Oregon where it rains a lot I need rain gear I can rely on and this is not it. I liked the color though.
review.name: Not reliable to keep you dry

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket a couple weeks ago and wore it for the first time this morning.

Here are my thoughts -

1. I have no worries at all about the quality.  Carhartt has always made quality stuff.
2. In the rain, it did what it is supposed to do.

3. (And the reason for the 3 star instead of 5 star rating) - there is no moisture management - aka Pit Zips on this rain jacket.  When I got home from walking the dog, the inside of of the jacket was as wet as the outside of the jacket.  

Being a hiker and scenic photographer, I need gear that keeps me protected, warm, and dry.  I would definitely not wear this out in the elements while hiking to a location.

This jacket would be good for more of a "stylish" wear.  The functionality for outdoor active people is lacking.
review.name: Good, but not great.

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Light weight yet substantial barrier to the elements!  Fit was a spot on for a large.
review.name: Sporty

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: It's not water proof, worked in the rain and after a few hour it was soaked through
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
DO NOT buy their lightweight Storm Defender jackets. It's "waterproof" for the first 5 minutes then starts to soak into the fabric. By the time you walk a good 20 minutes in the rain your clothes underneath are soaked. This is my second purchase of this type of rain jacket and both perform poorly. Also, be very careful when washing these jackets and wash them delicately. I had the entire inside polymer liner disintegrate from a normal washing cycle. When brought to Carhartts attention they were silent..
Save your money and buy an Orvis raincoat.
review.name: Not Waterproof At All

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent product, fits great, look great, and functions perfectly. Even the hood works
review.name: Richard

review.itemreviewed: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I worked construction my whole life so I know what carhartt is, i've worn more Carhartt gear than I'd like to admit to, but once you buy one, you have it for life if you wear a Carhartt jacket or hoodie out you're doing some job. As far as the rain gear I just got excellent product. Just retired to Florida, so dealing with Florida storms in the summertime, this is an excellent jacket can handle heavy rain, wind, and any storm Fla Is going to throw at you . I recommend 100%. 
PS AND I'M SURE I'LL NEVER HAVE TO BUY ANOTHER ONE BECAUSE THIS ONE WILL LAST.

name: Storm Defender Relaxed Fit LW Packable Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Got this new pair 41 size. 
After a 20-30km the right boot hurts my inner malleolus ankle pretty badly. I sent a email to Alpina customer service. I guess I have to return the pair to Backcountry I don’t know what to do exactly. A real bummer. The left boot is absolutely perfect. I wish I can solve this problem. I really like the brand. I would love to feel as good in the right boot as the left one. The precision on the toes is amazing.
review.name: Mixed feelings

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Ignite Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This helmet performs as expected, and is overall a great option at this price point. I really like the ventilation design of the this helmet, and it has a great boa adjustment.

My only complaint is the ear loop straps. The helmet is bad for people with a low crown height, because you cannot shorten the ear strap loops like every helmet made for the past 50 years. I hope smith returns to the very nice adjustable eat straps still on the network helmet. This change feels like a value loss on all the higher end helmets.
review.name: Great Helmet, bad strap design

review.reviewBody:
Had a nasty crash at 36mph and the helmet crumbled and cracked taking a huge amount of force. Don’t remember much but the emergency room doc telling me if I had a worse helmet I probably wouldn’t be here.

So I’m insanely thankful for all the safety features of this helmet.

Plus it looks good!
review.name: Saved my life

review.reviewBody: Purchased this helmet a few months ago based on a recommendation. As it turns out, I purchased it about 3 weeks before I was hit by a car that was traveling 60mph while cycling. Throughout my 5 weeks in the hospital, the doctors said that the helmet saved my life. I owe my life to the quality of this helmet. I’ll be a Smith customer for life.
review.name: Life Saving

review.reviewBody: Finally, a Helmet that works. Great fit plenty of venting. I sweat a lot ever since I lost my my hair. Headbands, halo they work to a certain degree but this helmet paired with chromo pop lenses are a game changer. It’s hot in South Fl
review.name: Ignite Awesome Helmet

review.reviewBody: I love this helmet it’s fast and cool, I live in the Deep South USA, and this past Saturday I had a bad crash which resulted in contusions on my ribs and right kidney. Could’ve been worse though my ignite saved my head. It’s busted up but my head is fine. Fixing to buy another!
review.name: Great for speed great for crash

review.reviewBody:
Fits really well to my Asian head contours. 
Padding is just right, provides the right comfort with minimal weight. 
Adjustment is top notch as it really fits to my head just snugly. Awesome built!
review.name: 5 stars road helmet

review.reviewBody: Used it first in a 70.3 Triathlon and fitted well and no interference with my sunglasses.
review.name: Used it first in a

review.reviewBody:
Purchased this product for my son at his request. He is a triathlete who knows what he wants. Since he chose your product, it must be good!!
The ratings below are about him.
review.name: Purchased this product for my

review.reviewBody:
airflow ok during hot and humid weather.
light.
looks ok
review.name: ignite feedback

review.reviewBody: The Ignite is a great helmet. The shape and fit of the helmet works well with my headshape. A key feature for me is the integration of the helmet with Smith's sunglasses. Being able to stow glasses away in the vents and having confidence that they then won't fall out is a huge win in my book. I went through many combinations and returns before finding the Smith combination of helmet and glasses. My hope is that all future designs for both helmet and glasses have this key integration in mind. I'm glad that I came up on the Smith brand.
review.name: Great Helmet

name: Ignite Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: Never wore a helmet, which admittedly was ridiculous. Was pleasantly surprised how natural wearing this helmet felt. Now, I feel more confident on the mountain and am setting a great example for my kids.
review.name: Never wore a helmet, which

review.reviewBody: Immediately fell Day 1, pitched forward and hit my head on an icy slope. I could feel the helmet allow my head to rotate a little to deflect the impact. I quickly recovered and did not even end up with a headache! I was so grateful that I invested in this helmet. Also it was incredibly comfortable and warm. I skied in January and didn't need a hat underneath the helmet. My ears were comfortable all day despite being out for 6 hours. I have the Liberty helmet and I bought my daughters the Vida (black) and the Mission (white). They loved their helmets, too! The snowboarder with us is also in a Smith helmet and he attached a GoPro to his.
review.name: Saved me from a headache or worse

review.reviewBody: Great fit. I hardly notice the helmet is on my head.
review.name: Great fit, hardly notice it is there.

review.reviewBody: Love it! Fits nicely! I have found it makes a lot of sense to try on helmet and goggles together! Best to buy goggles of same brand! Would recommend feel safe! Tighten that chin strap won’t do you much good if loose!
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody: Love this helmet. Could not ask for anything more out of it.
review.name: Love this helmet. Could not

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the best helmet, great craftsmanship and the size is perfect. Thanks for all the perfection put forth in bringing great products to us, your customers
review.name: Absolutely the best helmet, great

review.reviewBody: Great helmet!!! Only thing is change is to make the vents flush with the helmet because the vents will collect water on wet days and slowly drain onto your head, making you wet. To get around this you have to tip your head all the way down to drain the vents, problem solved.
review.name: Great helmet!!! Only thing is

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and warm! Plus the amethyst color is really cute! I love that it has absolutely no gap with my goggles, and the dial to adjust sizing works great.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Comfy helmet that fits snug on my small head! I thought they came down very low on my neck but it didn't interfere at all with neck or head mobility on the mountain.
review.name: You only get one head and brain

review.reviewBody: Love the fit and plenty of warmth on those windy days.
review.name: Love the fit and plenty

name: Liberty Helmet - Women's

description: Buy the LEKI Copper 3D Pro Glove - Men's online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Copper 3D Pro Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the LEKI Copper 3D Pro Glove - Men's online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The Leki Copper 3D Pro gloves are my ultimate go-to choice. In fact, I love them so much that I own three pairs in different colors! With over 45 years of skiing experience and clocking in 50+ days on the mountain annually, I can confidently say that these gloves are my favorite.

My oldest pair, which has served me faithfully for over eight years, has now found a new purpose as my go-to parking lot and snowblower gloves. Despite their age and heavy use, they're still in remarkable shape.
review.name: Best Liki Cold Weather Glove.

review.reviewBody: Отличные перчатки, удобные, очень мягкие и тёплые! у меня уже есть перчатки  LEKI но другая модель, всем могу посоветовать кто катается на горных лыжах иметь такие перчатки!
review.name: Лучшие перчатки!

review.reviewBody:
I have been skiing for a long, long time, and I tend to be picky about my gear.  These gloves are without a doubt the BEST ski gloves on the market.  Hestras are pretty good, but these are much better.  The supple goatskin leather needs no break-in and just gets better with use, plus smells great.  The pleating on the back lets the gloves flex with no binding.  The reverse-seam construction puts the seam bulk on the OUTside; combined with the pre-curved fingers make them incredibly comfortable to use.  Snug fitting neoprene cuffs (clever) with wide velcro straps, super grippy palm material and of course the Trigger system integrated in.  The Primaloft insulation has never left my hands cold, down into the single digit temps.  These Leki gloves ooze quality throughout.

The only thing missing are wrist leashes, but I solved that with some Hestra ones (available separately), which attached perfectly to loops already on the inside of these gloves.
review.name: The BEST ski gloves on the market.

review.reviewBody: Leki does it right, their poles and accessories are well designed and built.
review.name: Great Gloves

review.reviewBody: Worked great with trigger system all season ( ski instructor working 3 days a week )
review.name: Leki ski poles

review.reviewBody: Great feel, look, and fit. But need hard warmers. Love the leather finishes and craftsmanship too.
review.name: Gloves that stand out and are comfortable

name: Copper 3D Pro Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Understanding high end gore Tex  shells are like space suits for ensuring mountain adventure enjoyablity this shell exceeded expectations.
2 inch’s of rain on trail one day 6 inch’s of snow another.
Sleet!
Even was able to wear it directly on skin while clothing was all in the wash.
I have understanding you get what you pay for and membrane fabric has a life expectancy.
I’m normally on the cheap but happy I ponied up for this for my euro trek.
Was the piece of gear that insured my enjoyment of a lot more weather than was expected 
Thanks gore Tex and rab

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love salomon shoes. I have owned so many pairs over the years. This is the first one I’ve been disappointed with. The fabric around the toes bends in a way that it makes a loud pop each time I step. I read other reviews with others having the same problem, but I decided to try it out anyway. It’s so loud it’s almost unbearable to wear them.
review.name: Popping sound when walking

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the most comfortable pair of working shoes that I have. I love the cushioning and the grip even on wet floors. I have wide feet and Sense ride 4 is very comfortable even if I wear it for 8-12 hours. I also like that I don't have to worry tripping on my shoe lace or tying the laces often.
review.name: Great work shoes for a nurse!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: It is among the most comfortable shoes I had for my all terrains runs. I just bought my 4th pair and still so happy with them. They are so comfortable that I even use them as my day to day comfy shoes to walk on the around.
review.name: Not my first and not my last Sense Ride shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these in the spring for day hikes and absolutely loved how light they are! Great traction! Have worn on every camping/hiking/biking activity.  Loved them so much I bought 2 more pair!
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: very good and comfortable for distances even up to 50 km. versatile
review.name: great

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Best trail shoes for me. Been going back every time. True to size.
review.name: Great shoes

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for an upcoming trip and they were great! They took no time to break in and left me pain free after being on my feet all day. I was surprised by how pink they are in person when the photos make them look more neutral/sandy. The clicking sound IS present; but I found that the more I wear them, the less it happens and it doesn't bother me.
review.name: Pretty in Pink

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this on my trip to the US, love the color and fit. Easy to clean. Very comfortable to wear. Grips well on rock and mud.
review.name: Comfortability and Stability Control is Superb

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall, comfortable shoe. Super irritated by the shallow pocket to tuck laces into. The rope lace covers the pocket and when cinching shoes up, nearly impossible to tuck laces according to how Salomon typically designs this feature.
review.name: Nice, but hate pocket design for laces

review.itemreviewed: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love this shoe!  The plastic tip on laces bounce when walking/running. It’s annoying.
review.name: Great shoe

name: Sense Ride 4 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these a couple weeks ago for hiking. So comfy when we're hiking in various terrain: wet and dry. No chaffing, soft material, and dries easily. The length was perfect.
review.name: Super comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Love the color and feel of these shorts. The buckle mechanism is fun.
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts. Bought them on sale. The only reason I didn’t give 5 starts was the issue with the belt that I read about in the reviews. It gets twisted and is difficult/pointless to fix since it just gets twisted the next time you remove them. I think in the newer versions they may have fixed this. I’m normally a small but ordered a medium for a looser fit and knowing the belt would adjust to fit me. 28” waist 40” hip
review.name: Great hiking shorts

review.reviewBody: These are rather expensive shorts. I find Outdoor Research products to be higher priced.  I decided to purchase them because they have many great reviews, and I also bought them with a little discount which softened the sticker shock.  On the model, the shorts look baggy.  I figured maybe that's because the model is pretty thin.  Wrong.  They are baggy and comfortable but not very attractive.
review.name: Not impressed

review.reviewBody: I bought these shorts for hiking and and some water exposure. The shorts are well made and comfortable. The only thing I don't like is that the belt gets twisted up inside the tract very easily when dressing and undressing. The fit is good and I would say true to size.
review.name: Great for an active summer

review.reviewBody: I love Ferrosi shorts! I enjoy how lightweight they are yet they also have the built in belt so I can ensure for my various activities they fit how I need them to!
review.name: Comfortable and Functional

review.reviewBody: These shorts feel great for hiking or running.
review.name: Great fit, durable but light and unrestricted

review.reviewBody: Color is cool, fits nice - I'm 5' 105 lbs purchased in xs. Good OR quality
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: These shorts look and fit great. Flexible for romping around with my son and dog, they dry fast, provide a bit of protection from the sun with the 5" length. I love the built in belt, too, making it easy to adjust all day. I think they're true to size. I'm 5'4, 115 pounds and bought a size XS.
review.name: Daily shorts for all adventures

review.reviewBody: I love these shorts so much I ordered other colors! I got the lavender and initially ordered a medium but traded for a small (I wear size 6 pants).
review.name: Love them !

name: Ferrosi 5in Short - Women's

description: Buy the SRAM Maven Ultimate Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Maven Ultimate Disc Brake
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM Maven Ultimate Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Maven Ultimate Disc Brake
hasVariant.description: Buy the SRAM Maven Ultimate Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been running these brakes for over 300 miles now and they feel as powerful and responsive as day 1.  They are truly confidence-inspiring, which says a lot compared to some of the other lines of Sram brakes.  I have never felt I've had to pull them to the bar for them to bite and after a long descent with heavy braking zones, there is little if any fade at all, they are incredibly consistent in any temp and on any decent. I was running 220/200 rotors previously but have been able to size down to 200/180 and still feel that I have more braking power.  For any enduro/DH/aggressive trail rig where you are looking for all the power you can get, I'd highly recommend these, they are game changers.
review.name: These are legit!

review.reviewBody: The amount of power from these is unreal. I sized down my front rotor size (recommended by Sram) and I’m still amazed at the feel and strength. Can’t wait to really put them through the test this summer.
review.name: The ultimate stopping power

review.reviewBody: The bike industry just ain’t getting the fact that we the consumer are fed up with your stupid pricing
review.name: SIX HUNDRED BUCKS

name: Maven Ultimate Disc Brake
